Detailed Description

Service Functions for Data Evaluation.

Defines functions for the interpretation of data received from the NHands controller.

All measurement data received come together with a set of metadata that describes the encoding of independent and dependent variables and allows the conversion to physical units. The metadata reflect the configuration of the measurement but are strictly synchronized with the data. I.e. a set of meta data always belongs to the data block it is delivered with, no matter if the corresponding configuration has been delayed for some reason.

The metadata don't change during a measurement as long as no important parameters are changed.

Definition in file metadata.h.

enum DYB_MRc

Returncodes of the functions.

Enumerator:
DYB_MetaOk 

Function call was successful.

DYB_MetaNotApp 

Function not applicable for current data order.

DYB_MetaInvalid 

Meta data set is invalid.

Definition at line 136 of file metadata.h.

enum DYB_Order

Data Ordering.

Ordering of the data, i.e. the kind of mapping of the data index to the physical independent variable(s). The variable(s) may

  • be one (like time) or two (a scan),
  • grow unlimited (like time) or may be cyclic (like a scan),
  • have an absolutely defined origin (e.g. spectroscopy) or not (like time, again)
  • perform a scan beginning with a line in forward or backward direction,
  • have subsequent scan lines in the same direction only or alternating between forward and backward.

The first frame of a scan always runs bottom to top, the Y direction of subsequent frames alternate.

Enumerator:
DYB_Linear 

1 Variable, unlimited, no origin defined

DYB_Triggered 

1 Variable, unlimited, absolute origin defined

DYB_FfScan 

2 Variables, forward-forward scan, origin defined

DYB_FbScan 

2 Variables, forward-backward scan, origin def

DYB_BbScan 

2 Variables, backward-backward scan, origin def

DYB_BfScan 

2 Variables, backward-forward scan, origin def

Definition at line 58 of file metadata.h.

enum DYB_Unit

Physical Unit.

Possible physical units of independent and dependent variables. Note that the two LSBs encode a scaling factor.

Function Documentation

DYB_MRc DYB_CC DYB_convIndex2Direction ( const DYB_Meta *  meta,
Int32  index,
Bln32 *  forward,
Bln32 *  upward 
)

Scan Direction from Data Index.

Calclulates the current scan direction corresponding to a particular index. The direction is seen from the coordinate origin which is bottom left.

Parameters:
meta Meta data set
index Data index
forward Output: If the current scan direction is forward
upward Output: If the current scan direction is upward
Returns:
Success code
DYB_MRc DYB_CC DYB_convIndex2Phys1 ( const DYB_Meta *  meta,
Int32  index,
Flt32 *  x 
)

Physical Position from Data Index for one variable.

Converts a data index to the physical coordinates of the data point if one independent variable exists. If the data order is DYB_Linear, the absolute value is meaningless but differences are valid. The corresponding unit can be retreived by DYB_getUnitXY().

Parameters:
meta Meta data set
index Data index
x Output: independent variable
Returns:
Success code
DYB_MRc DYB_CC DYB_convIndex2Phys2 ( const DYB_Meta *  meta,
Int32  index,
Flt32 *  x,
Flt32 *  y 
)

Physical Position from Data Index for two variables.

Converts a data index to the physical coordinates of the data point if the data originate from a scan. The origin is bottom left. The corresponding unit can be retreived by DYB_getUnitXY().

Parameters:
meta Meta data set
index Data index
x Output: Horizontal position
y Output: Vertical position
Returns:
Success code
DYB_MRc DYB_CC DYB_convIndex2Pixel ( const DYB_Meta *  meta,
Int32  index,
Int32 *  x,
Int32 *  y 
)

Pixel Position from Data Index.

Converts a data index to the pixel position (i.e. column and line number) if the data originate from a scan. The coordinate origin is bottom left.

Parameters:
meta Meta data set
index Data index
x Output: Horizontal pixel position (column number)
y Output: Vertical pixel position (line number)
Returns:
Success code

Int32  value 
)

Data Value.

Converts a raw data value to the physical value. The unit can be retreived by DYB_getUnitVal().

Parameters:

value Raw data value
Returns:
Physical value

DYB_MRc DYB_CC DYB_getPhysRangeX ( const DYB_Meta *  meta,
Flt32 *  rangeX 
)

Physical Range X.

Returns the physical length of a line of data for cyclic data order. The length is the distance between the first and the last point of the line.

Parameters:
meta Meta data set
rangeX Output: Line length
Returns:
Success code
DYB_MRc DYB_CC DYB_getPhysRangeY ( const DYB_Meta *  meta,
Flt32 *  rangeY 
)

Physical Range Y.

Returns the physical height of the scan area if applicable. The height is the distance between the first and the last line of the frame.

Parameters:
meta Meta data set
rangeY Output: Column height
Returns:
Success code
